name: Drupal Console
description: The Drupal CLI. A tool to generate boilerplate code, interact with and debug Drupal.

name: DrupalVM
description: Drupal VM makes building Drupal development environments quick and easy, and introduces developers to the wonderful world of Drupal development on virtual machines or Docker containers (instead of crufty old MAMP/WAMP-based development).

name: Drush
description: Drush is a command line shell and Unix scripting interface for Drupal. Drush core ships with lots of useful commands for interacting with code like modules/themes/profiles. Similarly, it runs update.php, executes sql queries and DB migrations, and misc utilities like run cron or clear cache.

name: Yo Hedley!
description: Scaffold a headless Drupal backend, Angular app client, and Behat tests.

name: DDEV-Local
description: A Docker-based tool to create and manage local development environments. Use for other PHP apps too. Also see the Get Started Guide

name: Administration menu
description: Provides a theme-independent administration interface (aka. navigation, back-end).

name: Administration views
description: Replaces administrative overview/listing pages with actual views for superior usability.

name: Backup and Migrate
description: Back up and restore your Drupal MySQL database, code, and files or migrate a site between environments. Backup and Migrate supports gzip, bzip and zip compression as well as automatic scheduled backups.

name: Better Exposed Filters
description: Back up and restore your Drupal MySQL database, code, and files or migrate a site between environments. Backup and Migrate supports gzip, bzip and zip compression as well as automatic scheduled backups.

name: CKEditor
description: WYSIWYG HTML editor - This module will allow Drupal to replace textarea fields with the CKEditor - a visual HTML editor, usually called a WYSIWYG editor.

name: Colorbox
description: Colorbox is a light-weight customizable lightbox plugin for jQuery. This module allows for integration of Colorbox into Drupal.

name: Context
description: Context allows you to manage contextual conditions and reactions for different portions of your site. You can think of each context as representing a "section" of your site.

name: Display Suite
description: Display Suite allows you to take full control over how your content is displayed using a drag and drop interface.

name: RESTful module
description: Allows Drupal to be operated via RESTful HTTP requests, using best practices for security, performance, and usability.

name: Organic groups module
description: Enable users to create and manage their own 'groups'.

name: Message
description: Enables logging and displaying system events in a number of different use cases.

name: Message Notify  – Forward messages when they are generated.
Message Subscribe – Register to be notified when messages are generated for specific content.
Module Filter – The modules list page can become quite big when dealing with a fairly large site or even just a dev site meant for testing new and various modules being considered.
Entities Diagram Graph
description: Generates a graph of the entities, fields and their relationship of a particular installation of Drupal 7.

name: Owl Carousel
description: This module integrates the wonderful Owl Carousel slider built by OwlFonk.

name: csv2sql
description: Convert CSV to SQL and create a table in your Drupal installation.

name: Logs HTTP
description: Provides JSON event pushing to Logs via the tag/http endpoint.

name: Features
description: Enables the capture and management of features in Drupal. A feature is a collection of Drupal entities which taken together satisfy a certain use-case.

name: Commerce
description: Used to build eCommerce websites and applications of all sizes.

name: Views
description: Allows administrators and site designers to create, manage, and display lists of content.

name: Panels
description: Allows a site administrator to create customized layouts for multiple uses.

name: Panelizer
description: Allows a site administrator to create customized layouts for multiple uses.

name: Pathauto
description: The Pathauto module automatically generates URL/path aliases for various kinds of content (nodes, taxonomy terms, users) without requiring the user to manually specify the path alias.

name: Ctools
description: This suite is primarily a set of APIs and tools to improve the developer experience.

name: Search API
description: Provides a framework for easily creating searches on any entity known to Drupal, using any kind of search engine.

name: Slick
description: Slick is a powerful and performant slideshow/carousel solution leveraging Ken Wheeler's Slick carousel. See http://kenwheeler.github.io/slick

name: Token
description: Provides additional tokens not supported by core (most notably fields), as well as a UI for browsing tokens.

name: Ubercart
description: Ubercart is the most popular Drupal E-Commerce platform for your website. It implements everything you need to start selling products online.

name: Rules
description: The Rules module allows site administrators to define conditionally executed actions based on occurring events (known as reactive or ECA rules).

name: Entity API
description: Extends the entity API of Drupal core in order to provide a unified way to deal with entities and their properties.

name: Entity cache
description: Puts core entities into Drupal's cache API.

name: elFinder file manager
description: elFinder is a open source AJAX file manager

name: IMCE
description: IMCE is an image/file uploader and browser that supports personal directories and quota.

name: Date
description: Contains both a flexible date/time field type Date field and a Date API that other modules can use.

name: Devel
description: Suite of modules containing fun for module developers and themers.

name: Migrate
description: Provides a flexible framework for migrating content into Drupal from other sources.

name: Entity validator
description: Allows you to define a plugin and set methods to validate the object you'r dealing with.

name: Webform
description: Webform is the module for making forms and surveys in Drupal.

name: WYSIWYG
description: Allows the use of client-side editors to edit content.

name: OpenPublic

name: OpenPublish
